evidence.text: Person B: Because Hedda wants him to end his life courageously, romantically-
Person A: Your mother is busy with her company right now. So we need peace and quiet- It’s a scary time.
Person B: Being a CEO is- being a collaborator- a nurturer. I see myself as a strategy expert but also- a human expert.
Person A: Am I-- relevant to you as a director?

Person B: When I’m on my phone it’s for work. Especially now -you know that.
Person A: As if that’s a good excuse! That’s the whole problem!
Person B: You look beautiful, and we have this shot, but it’s not the style we are going for. It’s not what we agreed upon.

Person A: Romy, come on. Jesus-
Person A: Let them wear what they want!
Person A: It’s the one night I need you by my side.

Person A: No.
Person B: I know. I’m so sorry. It’s just there is so much pressure now-

Person B: I’ve never had an orgasm with you-
Person A: What?
Person B: Don’t fucking touch me-
Person B: I can’t- I can’t come with you.

Person A: Did you- Did you mean what you said? About never-
Person A: I- I’ve never- Normally, you know- Women- you know, they-
Person B: I’m not normal. I’m not other women! Look at me. I’m not normal.
Person A: No. You’re not.

Person B: I sometimes- tried to- But you never seem to be... into it.
Person B: I just want to be normal. I want to be normal- I want to be what you like. I want to be the woman you like-
Person A: I’m sorry, Romy, I don’t know what you mean- could you...be a little more specific-
Person A: Who?
Person A: What did you do? What?
Person A: Who is this guy? Are you in love with him?

Person B: You sat at my fucking table. You talked to my girls.
Person B: How long? How fucking long? You lied to me- you fucking lied to me!
